text:
Welcome to the Baltimore City
Police Crime Lab
firearms reference collection.

I'm Jim Wagster. I'm a 
firearms examiner

at the Baltimore City
Police Department.

This reference collection is
all firearms

that were recovered 
off the street.

Every year we get approximately
3,000 firearms in.

Sometimes a little more,
sometimes it's a little less,

but the average being right
around 3,000.

to my right here is just a
collection of some
of the semiautomatics.

They run from a Beretta,
like was issued to

the military and a lot of the
police departments,

and also down to German 
World War II firearms.

This is a more modern 12 gauge
pump action shotgun.

It's more representative of
what we get in now.

Behind me is a collection of
semiautomatics.

They run from .25s, .32s, 
.380s, 9 millimeters.

And this is just typical of the
smaller type caliber
semiautomatic pistols.
